Job Title: SAP PP Application Specialist - Contract to Hire

Location: Wisconsin, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
As an SAP PP Application Specialist III, you'll play a pivotal role in driving strategic business initiatives in an SAP ECC environment. This opportunity will have you deeply engaged in reviewing and refining processes, primarily focused on planning, sales & distribution, and product definition. Our aim is to enhance forecasting and planning capabilities, which will involve selecting a new tool, implementing process changes, and collaborating closely with our IT department on system enhancements.
Your responsibilities will include assessing business needs, analyzing requirements, configuring applications, leading project teams, and ensuring seamless communication between IT and business stakeholders.
Job DetailsVideo InterviewsStart ASAP Remote - 5-10% travel to Wisconsin 6 months contract to hire opportunity 
Key ResponsibilitiesThoroughly assess existing processes related to planning, SD, and product definition. Identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.Participate in the process of selecting and implementing a new tool to improve forecasting and planning capabilities.Drive the adoption of process changes by effectively communicating with stakeholders and providing necessary training and support.Lead the writing of functional requirements, configure and develop test plans and scripts, and conduct component, integration, and user acceptance testsManage advanced production support issues and service requests using ServiceNow while committing to timely resolution and adhering to SLAsPartner with business functions to expand business knowledge and increase functional expertise in multiple areas while being able to instinctively recommend to-be solutions to resolve business needsPromote information sharing across sites to optimize application usage and minimize duplicated development effortsRole requires occasional travel (5%-10%)
RequirementsBachelor's degree preferred in computer science, management information systems, or related field, or equivalent experience7+ years of experience in SAP PPExceptional verbal and written communication skillsFluent in English, other languages advantageous
What We OfferExciting opportunity to work for a global company dedicated to sustainabilityCoaching and personal development opportunitiesLong-term career growth prospects - from Application Specialist III to Solution Architect, Team Lead, Application Manager, and then Senior Application Manager.$1 for $1 401k matching up to 7%Annual bonus based on company performance, up to 10%

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
